D V X 

X

XClass - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
Terms: The framework will work with a "target" java application and provides the ability to inject method calls into methods of the target java application (into "target methods" of "target classes").
XClassLoaderPolicy - Enum in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
The enumeration of options for the ClassLoader to use when loading injected classes.
XField - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
If an argument of the injected method is annotated with XField the value of the corresponding field from the target class is injected into this argument.
XInvokeParam - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
Used when instrumenting before, after or instead of a method invocation: If a parameter of the injected method is annotated with XInvokeParam the value of the corresponding call argument of the instrumented method invocation is injected here.
XInvokeReturn - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
The first parameter of the injected method may be annotated with XInvokeReturn if and only if the XMethod.location() is set to .
XInvokeThis - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
If a parameter of the injected method is annotated with XInvokeThis the target of the current invocation will be injected into this parameter when called.
XLocation - Enum in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
Method calls can be injected in different locations: ENTRY: method is called directly after entering the target method.
XMethod - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
Methods inside of a class annotated with XClass can be annotated with XMethod to define that they are intended to be called from the target class.
XParam - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
If a parameter of the injected method is annotated with XParam the value of one of the arguments of the target method will be injected into this parameter when called.
XReturn - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
The first parameter of the injected method may be annotated with XReturn if and only if the XMethod.location() is set to .
XThis - Annotation Type in de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations
If a parameter of the injected method is annotated with XThis the object of the target method will be injected into this parameter when called.
